series.title: Divine Flow — The Father’s Love, the Son’s Grace, the Spirit’s Life

lesson.title: God’s Person
lesson.summary: One God in three persons for our experience: love (source), grace (expression), fellowship (transmission); God is intimate and receiving.

points.point: Trinity revealed for dispensing God into us.
Love, grace, fellowship — one flow for experience.
Friend and Father: God welcomes us home.

lesson.practice: “Father, Son, Spirit — one God with me now.”

lesson.title: God’s Attributes
lesson.summary: Attributes are God’s inner nature (life, love, light); when expressed in us they become virtues; His life, love, and light are for our walk.

points.point: Attributes vs. virtues — divinity expressed through humanity.
Only God’s life is true life; His love reaches us in mercy; His light illumines us.

lesson.practice: “Lord, shine; grow Your life in me.”

lesson.title: Holiness
lesson.summary: Holiness is God’s nature shared with us; righteousness is His unshakeable way; the Triune God operates in us.

points.point: Holy = different, saturated with God’s nature.
Righteousness: our steady ground — confess and be forgiven.
The Trinity is God acting in us now.

lesson.practice: “God, work in me; make me holy and steady.”

lesson.title: The Definition of God’s Economy
lesson.summary: God’s economy = His plan to dispense Himself into us: from the Father, in the Son, through the Spirit.

points.point: Dispensing Himself — mass “sharing” of God to people.
Love → grace → fellowship: one element in three stages.

lesson.practice: “Father’s love, Son’s grace, Spirit’s fellowship — flow in me.”

lesson.title: From the Father
lesson.summary: The Father embodied in the Son makes the invisible God accessible; Christ contains seven key ‘elements’ including incarnation, death, resurrection, ascension, enthronement.

points.point: Father becomes approachable in the Son.
Seven elements in Christ’s person and history.

lesson.practice: “Jesus, reveal the Father to me today.”

lesson.title: Through the Spirit
lesson.summary: All that the Father and Son are is transmitted to us in the Spirit of reality; the Spirit is ‘all-inclusive’ and makes us one spirit with the Lord.

points.point: Spirit as transmission: brings God in Christ into us.
All-inclusive Spirit includes Christ’s humanity, death, resurrection, ascension, enthronement.
Joined to the Lord — one spirit; freedom and supply.

lesson.practice: Call “O Lord Jesus” and be freshly supplied.
